item.description:

http://document.javido.net/e107_plugins/content/content.php?content.21

item.source: How to edit some bbc stuff

item.title: How to edit some bbc stuff
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

Yeah, then that’s going to be tough…unless, of course, you want to write your own code parser and syntax colorer But if you don’t know much php that’ll be too difficult.

Or if you want to implement one someone else wrote (this one for instance: http://document.javido.net/e107_plugins/content/content.php?content.21) - you could create a similar conditional to the [php] tag parser for [java] and use that highlight (or whichever you’d like) the content.

Read full topic

item.source: How to edit some bbc stuff

item.title: How to edit some bbc stuff
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

I believe it uses php’s highlight_string() function…why do you want the source code for it or do you want to edit it?

Editting it will be tough unless you want to modify the highlighting after highlight_string() is called, but if you want the source, you can probably get it from php.net

Read full topic

item.description:

also for this:

[php]
// Do PHP code coloring?
if ($php_parts[$php_i] != ‘<?php’)
continue;
[/php]

how do i make it read true so when in a [code bbc, it will show php colors?
